alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 7:53PM MDT until March 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches above 8,000 feet, except 18 to 36 inches above 9,500 feet in the Tusas Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph Tuesday and Wednesday across the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Chuska Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel is discouraged. Many road closures are likely. Avoid traveling if possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds and heavy, wet snow could bring down tree branches and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to the relatively warm temperatures, much of the snow will be heavy and wet, consisting of high moisture content. This may cause abnormally heavy weight on rooftops and other structures at high elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
